original: Elmstedt, Harry Waldemar, kom-munalikamrer, Silverforsen, Ronneby, f. 9/5/95 i Tving, Blek. 1., av nämndeman Herman E. o. Ida Mattsson. G. 21 m. Edith Billsten. Barn: Ulla f. 22, Lennart 23, Mats 31. — Anst. v. Kockums Jernverk i Kallinge o. A-B Wilh. Sonesson & Co. i Malmö t. 18, komm:kamr. i Ronneby landskommun sed. 19. Led. av Blek. idr:förb. styr. 25-46, styr:led. o. sekr. i IFK Ronneby 20-40, ordf. sed. 45, led. av styr. f. Ronneby Distr. Sparbank sed. 38, v. ordf. sed. 46, ordf. i Ronneby s:ns pens:nd sed. 42. Hobbies: fri idrott o. orientering. Blek. idr:förb. förtj :GM, Riksidr :förb. förtj :t. i guld.
translated: Elmstedt, Harry Waldemar, municipal accountant, Silverforsen, Ronneby, born May 9, 1895 in Tving, Blekinge County, the son of lay judge Herman E. and Ida Mattsson. Married in 1921 to Edith Billsten. Children: Ulla, born in 1922, Lennart in 1923, and Mats in 1931. Employed at Kockums Jernverk in Kallinge and A-B Wilh. Sonesson & Co. in Malmö until 1918, then municipal accountant in Ronneby municipality from 1919. Member of the Blekinge Sports Association Board from 1925 to 1946, Board member and secretary of the IFK Ronneby sports club from 1920 to 1940, chairman since 1945. Board member of the Ronneby District Savings Bank since 1938, vice chairman since 1946, chairman of the Ronneby town pension fund since 1942. Hobbies: free sports and orienteering. Awarded the Blekinge Sports Association's Gold Medal of Merit and the Swedish National Sports Association's Gold Medal of Merit.

awards.name: Blekinge Sports Association's Gold Medal of Merit
Swedish National Sports Association's Gold Medal of Merit
